name: Steel reinforcement bar; Blast furnace route; Production mix
description:
This process is part of the NETL Unit Process Library.  To access the library and the original dataset:
1) Navigate to the NETL LCA home page (http://www.netl.doe.gov/lca)
2) Then navigate to the “Unit Process Library” 
3) From the library, the unit process of interest can be found either through the "Complete Listing of the Unit Process Library link" or through the link to the "Unit Process Database" spreadsheet
4) For each process, a Data Sheet (DS) and Data File (DF) are available

BRIEF DESCRIPTION
This project encompasses the manufacturing of steel blast furnace (BF) reinforcement bar (rebar) wire rod.

GOAL AND SCOPE
This unit process provides a summary of relevant input and output flows associated with the manufacturing of steel blast furnace (BF) reinforcement bar (rebar) wire rod.  The data represents a world-wide, cradle-to-gate average of type BF steel rebar production with an 85 percent recovery rate.  The key inputs are raw materials and water.  Key outputs are air and water emissions from the manufacturing of steel BF plate such as carbon dioxide, nickel, and ammonia.  The unit process is based on the reference flow of 1 kg of steel BF rebar wire rod.  The relevant flows of this unit process are described below and shown in the associated documentation (referenced in the Citation and Associated Documentation section below).

BOUNDARY AND DESCRIPTION
A visual representation of the boundary of this unit process is available in the associated documentation (referenced in the Citation and Associated Documentation section below). Upstream emissions are not included in this study.  This unit process accounts for manufacturing emissions but does not account for acquisition of raw materials, which are accounted for outside the boundary of this unit process.

Data for the manufacturing of steel BF rebar wire rod were taken from a report on recycling scenarios for the International Iron and Steel Institute’s life cycle inventory (LCI).  Several datasets for steel products were in the report including a dataset for BF rebar wire rod.  The data was already scaled for 1 kg of steel; therefore, all inputs and outputs in this study were converted, if applicable, since the reference flow is 1 kg of steel BF rebar wire rod.

CITATION AND ASSOCIATED DOCUMENTATION
This dataset should be cited as: 
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2015. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data – Unit Process: Steel reinforcement bar; Blast furnace route; Production mix. U.S. Department of Energy, National Energy Technology Laboratory. Last Updated: September 2015 (version 01). Retrieved on [DATE] from [URL for this dataset].

This dataset is part of the NETL Unit Process Library.  The Library offers additional information concerning this dataset in the form of a Detailed Spreadsheet  Documentation (DS) file and a Process Documentation File (DF).  The DS file  is an Excel file that contains all of the parameters, inputs, and outputs for a given system as well as background data, calculations and quality scores.  The DF file is a PDF document that contains major assumptions and data sources that are the basis for each unit process.  The NETL Unit Process Library is located on the NETL website (netl.doe.gov) under Research / Energy Analysis / Energy Trends and Issues / Life Cycle Analysis / Unit Process Library.

This dataset was converted directly from the DS with additional supporting information provided by the DF.  Full citations for the DS and DF are given below.

DS File
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2013. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data – Unit Process: Steel BF Rebar Wire Rod, Manufacturing. U.S. Department of Energy, National Energy Technology Laboratory. Last Updated: June 2013 (version 01). Retrieved on 09/29/2015 from: http://www.netl.doe.gov/File%20Library/Research/Energy%20Analysis/Life%20Cycle%20Analysis/UP_Library/DS_Stage1_O_Surface_Steel_BF_Rebar_Wire_Rod_2013-01.xlsx.

DF File
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2013. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data – Unit Process: Steel BF Rebar Wire Rod, Manufacturing. U.S. Department of Energy, National Energy Technology Laboratory. Last Updated: June 2013 (version 01). Retrieved on 09/29/2015 from: http://www.netl.doe.gov/File%20Library/Research/Energy%20Analysis/Life%20Cycle%20Analysis/UP_Library/DS_Stage1_O_Surface_Steel_BF_Rebar_Wire_Rod_2013-01.pdf.

processDocumentation.timeDescription: This data set is representative of best available public data from 01/01/1999 to 12/31/2004 and is not subject to limited usability within sub-time spans (e.g. summer, winter).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This unit process provides a summary of relevant input and output flows associated with the manufacturing of steel blast furnace (BF) reinforcement bar (rebar) wire rod.  The data represents a world-wide, cradle-to-gate average of type BF steel rebar production with an 85 percent recovery rate.  The key inputs are raw materials and water.  Key outputs are air and water emissions from the manufacturing of steel BF plate such as carbon dioxide, nickel, and ammonia.  A visual representation of the boundary of this unit process is available in the associated documentation (referenced in the Citation and Associated Documentation section in the Description field). Data for the manufacturing of steel BF rebar wire rod were taken from a report on recycling scenarios for the International Iron and Steel Institute’s life cycle inventory (LCI).  Several datasets for steel products were in the report including a dataset for BF rebar wire rod.
processDocumentation.modelingConstantsDescription: All elementary and technosphere flows are calculated on a functional unit basis. Calculations involving combustion primarily to generate useful work are done using lower heating values (LHV) and calculations involving combustion primarily to generate useful heat are done using higher heating values (HHV). Unless explicitly stated in the associated reference documents applicable calculations assumed standard atmospheric temperature and pressure (SATP).
processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription:
Use of this dataset is not restricted, but a statement of attribution is required. Please use the following attribution statement:

Pittsburgh, PA 15236-0940

B. Assumes any liability with this report as to its use, or damages resulting from the use of any information, apparatus, method, or process disclosed in this document.

Reference herein to any specific commercial product, process, or service by trade name, trademark, manufacturer, or otherwise, does not necessarily constitute or imply its endorsement, recommendation, or favoring by NETL. The views and opinions of the authors expressed herein do not necessarily state or reflect those of NETL.
processDocumentation.intendedApplication: This is a cradle-to-gate manufacturing process and can be used for any type of LCA study.
processDocumentation.projectDescription: National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL) Unit Process Library
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This unit process provides a summary of relevant input and output flows associated with the manufacturing of steel BF rebar wire rod.  The data represents a world-wide, cradle-to-gate average of type BF steel rebar production at an 85-percent recovery rate.
